channel.title: Need help with this code!

item.title: Need help with this code!
item.dc:creator: @excel4 excel4
item.description:
@excel4 wrote:

You need to add the item you would receive from using a needle on leather. Such as for 1 leather, you would get leather vambraces.

- Excel4

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with this code!
item.dc:creator: @seraphican seraphican
item.description:
@seraphican wrote:

Hi there! im fixing up my crafting but i have a problem here.

public void checkRequirements() {
for (int j = 0; j < expsAndLevels.length; j++) {
if (expsAndLevels[j][0] == hideType) {

			if (c.playerLevel[c.playerCrafting] >= expsAndLevels[j][1]) {
				if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(hideType, 1)) {
					c.getPA().closeAllWindows();
					exp = expsAndLevels[j][2];
					index = j;
					craftHides(hideType);

this is a cut from my checkreq,
and below is the cut from my craft hide

public void craftHides(int id) {
for (int j = 0; j < amount; j++) {
if (!c.getItems().playerHasItem(id,craftType))
break;
c.getItems().deleteItem(id, craftType);
if (getItemToAdd() <= 0)
break;
c.getItems().addItem(getItemToAdd(), 1);
c.getPA().addSkillXP(exp * Config.CRAFTING_EXPERIENCE, c.playerCrafting);

there are no errors compiling, however, the problem is when i use the needle on the hide, it doesnt craft. That probably means craftHides is reading an int id of 0.(btw, i have another int below declaring the values). how do i fix this? Would really appreciate if any of you can help me on this.

Read full topic
